title: Miami dominance and a UCLA stunner: Recapping a chaotic Week 6
content: In Week 6, the Grim Reaper came for Penn State and Texas, but Miami proved itself against Florida State.

title: Ex-QB Sanchez arrested, faces 3 possible charges
content: Former NFL quarterback and current Fox Sports broadcaster Mark Sanchez was arrested in Indianapolis on Saturday and is facing three misdemeanor charges in relation to an incident where he was stabbed and taken to a hospital.

title: With Skubal up next, Tigers notch 'huge' G1 win
content: After winning two of three in Cleveland during the wild-card round, the Detroit Tigers, who have spent the past two weeks on the road, took a 1-0 lead in the best-of-five American League Division Series on Saturday via a 3-2 win over the Seattle Mariners.

title: Pereira reclaims title in 80-second TKO of Ankalaev
content: Alex Pereira is the champion of the light heavyweights again after crushing Magomed Ankalaev in 80 seconds of Round 1 on Saturday at UFC 320.

title: Another Hernandez HR lifts Dodgers over Phillies
content: Teoscar Hernandez rallied the Los Angeles Dodgers with a three-run homer in the seventh inning that silenced the crowd and led his club to a 5-3 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies in Game 1 of their National League Division Series on Saturday night.

title: 'Embarrassing' loss at UCLA has Penn St. reeling
content: A week removed from its first loss of the season, a home defeat to Oregon, No. 7 Penn State dropped a 42-37 decision to previously winless UCLA at the Rose Bowl on Saturday, as the Bruins became the first 0-4 team to defeat a top-10 team since 1985.

title: Miami defends 'state champs' label, defeats FSU
content: With eyes now on an ACC championship and their first run in the College Football Playoff, No. 3 Miami wrapped up its version of the "state title" on Saturday night, defeating No. 18 Florida State 28-22, after earlier dispatching Florida and South Florida.

title: Vlad Jr.'s playoff breakout fuels Jays past Yanks
content: Vladimir Guerrero Jr.'s first-inning homer was part of a three-hit night that gave the Blue Jays a "jolt" in Saturday's 10-1 Game 1 win over the Yankees.

title: Sources: Collier cancels meeting with Engelbert
content: Minnesota Lynx forward Napheesa Collier has canceled her meeting with WNBA commissioner Cathy Engelbert next week, sources told ESPN.

title: 😆 Top trolls from college football Week 6
content: UCLA delivered a statement upset of Penn State on Saturday, and then brought the troll game to back it up afterward.

title: Cramming for NFL Week 5: Five fantasy sleepers, three predictions, three trends and an intriguing bet
content: Will the Giants' receivers step up? More success coming for Woody Marks? A lot of points expected in Raiders-Colts? Here's last-minute intel for Week 5.

title: Dramatic Chelsea win makes a statement and raises a question: Are Liverpool in crisis?
content: While Chelsea coach Enzo Maresca got a big statement win, worries for Liverpool and Mohamed Salah deepen.

title: How did the Browns decide on starting QB No. 41? Inside their 'intentional' methods
content: The quarterbacks room has been developed to give Dillon Gabriel (named Sunday's starter) and Shedeur Sanders space to grow.

title: Wetzel: Collier comments reflect WNBA's core problem: How it sees Caitlin Clark
content: In seeming to not embrace the player who singlehandedly lifted the WNBA, the league risks losing her fan base.

title: Marner in Vegas, Sullivan in New York and Crosby ... on the move? Guide to the NHL season
content: Miss anything the past few months? Miss everything? Get caught up here before opening night on Tuesday.

title: College football recruiting intel: Could we see big flips? Which classes could rise?
content: Are Florida recruits wavering? Could we see some five-star flips? We look at where the classes and top prospects stand.

title: Russell takes surprise Singapore pole over Verstappen
content: George Russell took a surprise pole position for Mercedes at the Singapore Grand Prix ahead of Red Bull's Max Verstappen in second place and championship leader Oscar Piastri in third.

title: Paolo Banchero, Trae Young: Breaking down 10 names that could define NBA season
content: ESPN's Tim Bontemps breaks down players and personnel that will play major roles on the court and beyond.

title: Eric Karabell's 'Do not draft' list, including LaMelo Ball, Ja Morant, Joel Embiid
content: Eric Karabell highlights the players to fade at their current average draft position in fantasy basketball drafts.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Last-minute pickups for Week 5: Jaxson Dart, Brenton Strange among top options
content: With many quality fantasy starters on byes this week, we have options at each position to fill in for you.

title: 'Two Hall of Fame quarterbacks just battling it out': A mini-oral history of 2015 Superdome Duel
content: With the Saints hosting the Giants on Sunday, we asked those who were there to recall the teams' epic 52-49 game.

title: Kelly scores stunner but Arsenal lose at Man City. Are Gunners' title hopes over already?
content: Arsenal's Chloe Kelly scored against former club Manchester City, but the Gunners fell to a defeat that puts a big early dent in their WSL title hopes.

title: Projecting 2026 No. 9 Jacy Abii's fit at Notre Dame, more five-star commits
content: Breaking down the fits of every five-star commitment, including the third Fighting Irish recruit for 2026-27.

title: Christian Horner's F1 return: Where next after Red Bull exit?
content: With Christian Horner now free to return to Formula 1 in 2026, speculation about his next landing spot is rife - ESPN ranks the likelihood of his options.

title: 📈 Ranking all 68 Power 4 QBs: A surprise No. 1
content: What have we learned about the signal-callers so far? Here's where Arch Manning, Beau Pribula and others stand.

title: 🩺 Tyreek Hill injury timeline, impact on Fins
content: What is the Dolphins WR's outlook for a dislocated knee, the on-field impact of his absence and his future in Miami.

title: 👊 MMA stars rank Hollywood actors as fighters
content: ESPN assembled a panel of MMA experts to determine which Hollywood stars would win a UFC-style event.

title: 🏆 Barnwell's NFL quarter-season awards
content: Can Josh Allen win another MVP? Could anyone edge Myles Garrett for DPOY? We ranked the top three candidates to win seven NFL awards through four weeks.

title: ⛳ Ryder envelope rule must change, Bradley says
content: U.S. captain Keegan Bradley said the Ryder Cup's longstanding envelope rule involving injured players should change, but European counterpart Luke Donald said it's there to protect players and should remain in place.

title: 🗣️ Players support Collier in ripping WNBA
content: Players across the WNBA supported Napheesa Collier after she ripped WNBA leadership in her exit interview Tuesday.

title: 💰 Sources: Big Ten mulling $2B capital deal
content: The Big Ten is in talks about a private capital deal, which includes a 10-year grant of rights extension through 2046, that would infuse at least $2 billion into the league and its schools, sources told ESPN.

title: 🏈 Colts CB Howard abruptly retires
content: Veteran cornerback Xavien Howard, 32, informed the Colts of his decision to retire just days after his much-criticized performance against the Rams.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Saudi clubs set to bid for Man Utd's Bruno in January
content: Saudi Pro League could come back in for Manchester United's Bruno Fernandes in January. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: West Bengal rains: 7 dead, several missing as landslides hit Darjeeling; iron bridge collapses
content: Kalimpong faced multiple landslides on Saturday after continuous heavy rainfall, disrupting traffic on NH10 and NH717A. Authorities confirmed no major damage or casualties, with teams actively clearing debris to restore connectivity. Heavy rain is predicted for West Bengal until October 6 due to a Bay of Bengal depression, urging vigilance.

title: 'Did unimaginable things': Greta accuses Israel of harsh treatment in custody — What she said
content: Greta Thunberg reported harsh treatment, dehydration, and bedbug-induced rashes in Israeli custody after her detention from a Gaza aid flotilla. Other activists alleged she was forced to hold Israeli flags, while NGOs cited systematic rights violations for detainees. Israel's embassy, however, denied all allegations, stating proper care was provided.

title: Eastern Nepal hit by Monsoon: At least 22 dead in landslides, flood
content: At least 18 people died in landslides and flooding in Ilam, Eastern Nepal, over the past 24 hours, with authorities expecting the death toll to rise. Security forces are evacuating residents in Kathmandu Valley as rivers swell. Several districts face high risk, and nearly two million people could be affected by the unexpected, renewed monsoon downpours.

title: 'Why is he even in the team?' – Ex-India captain lambasts Harshit selection
content: Former India selector Krishnamachari Srikkanth slammed Harshit Rana's ODI squad inclusion for the Australia tour, questioning constant reshuffles and Sanju Samson's omission. Srikkanth criticized Rana's rapid rise, unimpressive Asia Cup showing, and "filmy gimmicks," suggesting such selections jeopardize India's 2027 World Cup ambitions and dent player confidence.

title: Former Cisco CEO's dangerous prediction goes beyond AI replacing human jobs
content: Former Cisco CEO John Chambers warns AI will cause 50% of Fortune 500 companies and executives to disappear, moving five times faster than the internet age. He predicts rapid job destruction, especially for entry-level roles, necessitating urgent re-education. Only adaptable companies that reinvent themselves will survive this unprecedented business climate.

title: Zubeen Garg death mystery continues: Assam CM questions bandmate's 'poisoning' claim
content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma questioned the "poisoning" claims in Zubeen Garg's mysterious death, urging patience for the viscera report and cooperation from Singapore witnesses. He highlighted that the allegation came from an accused, not authorities. A judicial commission has been formed, and four individuals, including the alleged poisoners and the accuser, have been arrested in the ongoing probe.

title: Studying in New York: An Indian student’s ground reality; step beyond comfort now
content: An Indian student at Parsons School of Design in New York shares the realities of studying abroad, navigating a new city, adapting to project-based learning, and embracing opportunities beyond the classroom. From overcoming homesickness to showcasing work in Times Square, his journey highlights resilience, creativity, and growth. His advice: step outside your comfort zone for true learning.

title: Bitcoin reaches all-time high! Largest crypto surpasses $125,000 mark
content: Bitcoin surged to a new all-time high of $125,689, propelled by safe-haven demand amidst the US government shutdown and investor bets on dollar debasement. Corporate adoption and traditional October strength also fueled this record rise, with experts highlighting Bitcoin's distinct response to current economic uncertainties.

title: US govt shuts down: Embassy in India gives update; scheduled services will..
content: Amidst the ongoing US government shutdown, the US Embassy in India confirmed that scheduled visa and passport services will continue both in the United States and at overseas embassies. This shutdown, the first in nearly seven years, occurred after Republicans and Democrats failed to agree on federal funding, stemming from disagreements over a temporary measure versus health insurance subsidies.

title: Gurgaon horror: Invited by friend for party, teacher gang-raped by 4 men; all arrested
content: A 29-year-old foreign languages teacher in Gurgaon has accused four gym trainers of sexual assault and gang rape. The victim met one suspect, Gaurav, at a party, later agreeing to meet him on October 1. At a friend's address, Gaurav allegedly assaulted her, then called three others who also raped her. Police arrested all four suspects, now in judicial custody.

title: 'So sad!': Divya Deshmukh reacts to hilarious typo on her jersey - Watch
content: Women's World Cup winner Divya Deshmukh lightened the mood with a jersey typo during the 'Checkmate: USA vs India' exhibition. However, Team India suffered a 5-0 defeat to Team USA, highlighted by Hikaru Nakamura's dramatic bullet win over Gukesh Dommaraju. A return leg in India offers Team India a chance for redemption.

title: 'Pakistan my Janmabhoomi, but India is my Matrubhumi': Ex-Pak cricketer
content: Former Pakistan cricketer Danish Kaneria denied seeking Indian citizenship, stating he lives in the USA with his family. He expressed pride in his Pakistani identity despite facing discrimination and conversion pressure, clarifying his positive comments about India are not for citizenship. Kaneria, who calls India his ancestral land, also mentioned the CAA and his commitment to exposing anti-nationals.

title: US Army warns: Military network at ‘very high risk’; sends memo to these companies
content: A US Army memo has raised "very high risk" security concerns about the new NGC2 battlefield communications network, developed by Palantir and Anduril. The memo highlights issues like uncontrolled data access, untrackable user actions, and potential for adversary infiltration, despite a supervisor calling it part of a vulnerability assessment process.

title: Wall Street rallying despite gov shutdown concerns, here is what to look for
content: Defying a US government shutdown, the stock market surged to record highs, with broad gains across indices and assets. While AI optimism and anticipated Fed rate cuts fuel the rally, experts caution about expensive valuations nearing dot-com bubble levels. Future performance hinges on corporate earnings and AI's ability to boost productivity.

title: Doctor held after 11 kids die in MP from toxic Coldrif; TN manufacturers booked
content: A doctor in Chhindwara, Madhya Pradesh, has been arrested after 11 children reportedly died from consuming contaminated Coldrif cough syrup. Dr. Praveen Soni prescribed the syrup, with most children treated at his clinic. Police have also booked the Tamil Nadu-based pharmaceutical company responsible for manufacturing the alleged contaminated medicine.

title: All eyes on Gaza: Netanyahu positive on Hamas deal, Trump wary of any 'delay'
content: Hamas's readiness to release hostages under US President Donald Trump’s ceasefire plan has sparked guarded optimism from Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who vows to disarm the group. Mediated talks are set for Egypt, aiming for a deal involving hostage-prisoner exchanges and Israeli withdrawal. Despite hopes for peace, violence persists in Gaza, and questions remain about the plan's full implementation.

title: Scientists turn human skin cells into eggs in groundbreaking fertility breakthrough
content: US researchers successfully created early-stage human embryos from adult skin cells, bypassing traditional egg cells through advanced DNA manipulation. This groundbreaking OHSU study, mirroring cloning techniques, generated functional eggs that developed into early embryos. The innovation offers significant hope for infertility and same-sex couples, despite current low success rates and ethical considerations requiring further refinement.

title: Post Asia Cup win: Suryakumar Yadav reveals biggest regret; involves MS Dhoni
content: India's T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav expressed his regret at never playing under MS Dhoni's captaincy for the national team, though he admired his calm leadership. He described Virat Kohli as a hard taskmaster and Rohit Sharma as an inclusive leader.

title: 'Went to build better future': How 'robbery attempt' claimed Indian student's life in US
content: A 28-year-old Hyderabad student, Pole Chandrasekhar, was fatally shot in Texas, US, on October 3 during a suspected armed robbery at his part-time gas station job. Chandrasekhar, who was pursuing a master's, died on the spot. Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy expressed condolences and assured government support to repatriate his remains, with coordination underway with Indian officials.

title: US company lays off Indian workforce in 4 minutes: What happened; 8 coping tips
content: A US-based company recently laid off its Indian workforce in just four minutes during a virtual meeting, leaving employees shocked and unprepared. Beyond the financial impact, the emotional toll was severe. The focus is on the human side of sudden layoffs and eight practical coping strategies including financial planning, career rebuilding, and mental well-being to help professionals manage unexpected job loss.

title: Delhi court shocker: Man joins hearings in undergarments, smokes, drinks; arrested
content: Mohammad Imran, a 32-year-old history-sheeter with over 50 previous cases, was arrested for disrupting Tis Hazari Court virtual hearings. He appeared on screen in his undergarments, smoking and drinking, using fake identities. Police tracked him down after a complex investigation, revealing his drug and alcohol addiction led him to crime.

title: 'Rohit gave India 16 yrs, but we couldn't': Gill's role sparks questions
content: The BCCI announced Shubman Gill as the new ODI captain, concluding Rohit Sharma's successful leadership. Former cricketer Mohammad Kaif criticized this decision, highlighting Rohit's impressive record, including two recent ICC trophy wins, and questioning the premature transition. Rohit's future in ODI cricket and the 2027 World Cup now remain uncertain.

title: 'Cyclone Shakhti': IMD issues warning for Maha, Guj fishermen; heavy rain expected on Oct 8-9
content: Severe cyclonic storm Shakhti, formed off the Gujarat coast, moved westwards on Saturday, projected to curve east-northeastwards and weaken by October 6, 2025. Fishermen are advised against venturing into the northwest Arabian Sea. Concurrently, parts of Gujarat, including Dwarka and Ambaji, experienced rainfall, with Ahmedabad expecting light showers.

title: 'If you’re going to...' – Ex-India coach’s remark on Rohit’s removal
content: Rohit Sharma has been replaced by Shubman Gill as India's ODI captain for the upcoming Australia series, sparking debate over Rohit's future and his 2027 World Cup participation. Former coach Abhishek Nayar stressed the importance of clear communication in this transition, supporting Gill's leadership while highlighting Rohit's prior 2027 aspirations.

title: Kerala: TN man slaps Israeli tourist in Varkala after mobile snatching incident; booked
content: Kerala Police registered a case against a Tamil Nadu native for assaulting an Israeli tourist in Varkala. The tourist allegedly snatched the man's mobile phone and threw it into the Arabian Sea, leading to the assault.

title: How much alcohol is safe to drink? Experts explain the permissible daily limit
content: Alcohol has long been a part of social and cultural life, but the question of how much is truly safe remains complex. Science shows that alcohol has a biphasic effect — small amounts may offer some cardiovascular benefits, while higher intakes, even occasional, can harm the heart, liver, brain, and overall health. Individual factors like genetics, sex, and metabolism influence how the body processes alcohol, making “safe” levels vary from person to person.

title: 'Lawlessness plaguing US': Trump authorises 300 National Guard troops to Chicago
content: President Trump authorized 300 National Guard troops to Chicago to protect federal officers and assets, citing "lawlessness" and a recent shooting incident involving a federal officer and an armed motorist. This move is part of his broader anti-crime operations in Democratic-run cities, though a similar deployment to Portland was recently blocked by a federal judge.

title: Kayla Nicole fires back at Taylor Swift after alleged diss in ‘Opalite’ track
content: Kayla Nicole, Travis Kelce's ex-girlfriend, posted messages on social media. This followed speculation about Taylor Swift's song 'Opalite'. Fans believe Swift's lyrics from 'The Life of a Showgirl' targeted Nicole. Nicole shared photos and a video clip. Her posts are interpreted as a response to the alleged diss track. The situation adds to ongoing discussions about the celebrities.

title: Shata Dhauta Ghrita: Why it is the ultimate Indian beauty secret for soft, bright skin
content: Shata Dhauta Ghrita, an ancient Ayurvedic remedy is considered the perfect remedy for a healthy, soft and glowing skin. This ghee is washed 100 times with water in a copper vessel till it turns creamy and light.  Traditionally used for soothing burns, skin issues, and anti-aging, this natural preparation offers a rediscovered holistic, chemical-free alternative for modern skin rejuvenation.

title: Bihar elections: BJP seeks 2-phase polls; ally JD(U) says finish it at one go
content: Bihar's NDA allies, BJP and JD(U), have differing views on the upcoming assembly election schedule. BJP and several parties urged the Election Commission for a maximum of two phases to reduce costs, while JD(U) proposed a single phase, citing good law and order and potential Chhath festival voter participation. The EC is reviewing preparations in Patna.

title: Nirav Modi case: India may give 'no arrest' pledge to get him extradited
content: Indian agencies will assure a UK court that no new cases will be filed against fugitive Nirav Modi if he is extradited, and he won't face fresh arrests or interrogations beyond existing charges. This submission aims to counter Modi's appeal to reopen his extradition trial, which the UK High Court previously approved. The hearing is set for November 23.

title: Iridogorgia chewbacca: The deep-sea Wookiee coral found 400–1000m below
content: Marine biologists identified a new deep-sea coral species, Iridogorgia chewbacca. This coral was found near Molokaʻi and the Mariana Trench. Its long, shaggy branches resemble Chewbacca's fur. It thrives 400 to 1,000 metres deep. This discovery expands marine life knowledge and highlights deep-sea conservation needs.

title: Cardiologist reveals surprising cause of heart failure; not high BP or clogged arteries
content: Cardiologist Dmitry Yaranov highlights amyloidosis as an underdiagnosed cause of heart failure, often mistaken for hypertension or aging. This condition involves misfolded proteins stiffening the heart, making it difficult to pump blood effectively. Symptoms mimic common heart issues, leading to years of misdiagnosis, yet early detection is vital for patient outcomes.

title: Bruins’ Mark Kastelic charges at Rangers’ 6-foot-9 Matt Rempe without fear
content: Bruins' new forward Mark Kastelic charged Rangers' Matt Rempe in their final preseason game after both left the penalty box. This incident followed earlier physical plays and penalties, showcasing Kastelic's gritty character despite a significant size disadvantage. The fight, deemed a draw, highlighted Kastelic's readiness for tough bottom-six roles ahead of the Bruins' October 2025 season opener.

title: 'I don't see Virat, Rohit playing 2027 ODI World Cup'
content: Shubman Gill has been appointed India's new ODI captain for the upcoming Australia tour, replacing Rohit Sharma, with Shreyas Iyer named vice-captain. This leadership transition is seen as a forward-looking move for the 2027 World Cup, as Rohit Sharma steps away from all leadership roles. Experts praise Gill's appointment as crucial for shaping Indian cricket's future.

title: Cough syrup tragedy: MP bans Coldrif as kids' death toll rises to 11
content: Eleven children died in MP's Chhindwara from renal failure after consuming cough syrup. A lab report confirmed Coldrif syrup contained 48.6% diethylene glycol, a poisonous industrial chemical. This prompted MP to ban the medicine and other products from its manufacturer, Sresan Pharmaceuticals, while multi-state checks on drug units are now underway.

title: Gisele Bündchen finds healing in nature and family as ex-husband Tom Brady watches afar
content: Gisele Bündchen, 45, embraces a new chapter, sharing glimpses of her seven-month-old baby boy, life with Joaquim Valente, and her deep connection to nature. Her recent Instagram post highlighted a tender photo of her newborn and a message of mindfulness, showing her grounded lifestyle in Brazil focused on family and healing.

title: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt questions wellness after Austin health experience
content: Kansas City Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt recently experienced an "eye-opening" holistic wellness assessment at Medici Health, Austin. This comprehensive check-up, spanning heart screenings to vision tests, profoundly highlighted the critical importance of proactive self-care before health issues emerge. Hunt lauded the compassionate team and the Phillips family's vision, advocating for health as a continuous, empowering journey for all.

title: 'Forwarding pro-Pak message not sedition': Allahabad high court grants bail to man
content: The Allahabad High Court granted bail to a Meerut man, Sajid Chaudhary, accused of sharing a "Pakistan zindabad" post. The court observed that merely supporting another country does not constitute endangering India's sovereignty under BNS section 152, though it might fall under promoting enmity. Sajid was charged under BNS section 152 and had been incarcerated since May.

title: IND vs AUS: New skipper! Inside story of Gill's elevation as ODI captain
content: The Indian team management and the BCCI seems to be convinced that Rohit Sharma will not last till the 2027 ODI World Cup but the situation, surprisingly, has come down to a point where both Rohit and Virat Kohli, born two years apart and having different fitness levels, are being looked at from the same longevity lens.

title: Poisoning charges emerge in Zubeen Garg death case
content: The probe into Zubeen Garg’s death has dramatically escalated with fresh poisoning allegations now central to the inquiry. The SIT arrested manager Siddharth Sharma, citing a co-accused's claim that Zubeen was poisoned in Singapore by Sharma and Shyamkanu. A judicial commission has also launched its independent probe, with the CM awaiting the viscera report for truth.

title: Maharashtra: US national among 3 held for illegal conversion bid in Bhiwandi
content: Bhiwandi police arrested a 58-year-old US national and two local residents for allegedly attempting to convert villagers to Christianity in Chimbipada. The accused, including James Watson on a business visa, reportedly preached during a prayer meet, claiming Hinduism was superstitious and offering miraculous cures. They face charges under new laws and the Foreigners Act for misusing the visa.

title: IND vs WI: Bumrah's social media post after 1st test win goes viral
content: India secured an emphatic innings-and-140-run victory over West Indies, extending their unbeaten home streak. Jasprit Bumrah's viral Instagram post, "bayki sab fake hai," celebrated Mohammed Siraj's stellar 4-40 spell, referencing an old meme. Ravindra Jadeja, KL Rahul, and Dhruv Jurel also shone in the dominant win, with the second Test scheduled for October 10.

title: Love story that began with a wrong number ended in murder
content: A wrong number call blossomed into a secret affair, culminating in the murder of 30-year-old Sonam in Hardoi two years ago. Sonam, who pressured her married lover Maseedul to marry her, was killed by him, his brother, and father on August 8, 2023. Her skeleton was recovered from a well after two arrests, with Maseedul currently on the run.

title: Bihar Assembly elections LIVE: ECI reviews preparedness, to hold press conference today
content: On Sunday (October 5, 2025), the second day of its two-day visit to Bihar, the ECI reviewed the preparedness of enforcement agencies for the upcoming Legislative Assembly elections

title: Dhinakaran urges Tamil Nadu to ensure safety of medical professionals
content: The AMMK founder sought for severe action against those involved in assault of a trainee doctor by family members of a patient

title: Modi government promoting concentration of wealth; it's direct attack on soul of democracy: Congress
content: This huge concentration of wealth, driven by the Modi government's economic policies, is creating massive economic inequality in our country. This inequality is giving rise to widespread social insecurity and discontent, says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: Nagpur tops Maharashtra’s hailstorm risk index, finds IMD’s 30-year analysis
content: Comprehensive analysis shows rising hailstorm trends, with agriculture, infrastructure, and human safety increasingly at risk

title: Stray dog management: Puducherry asks communities to adopt a balanced approach that ensures public safety
content: The Puducherry Department of Animal Husbandry emphasises a balanced approach to stray dog vaccination and welfare, ensuring public safety

title: NCC cadets at the expedition camp undertake cleanliness drive
content: The camp is a key event in the quest for the coveted All-India ‘Ocean Sailing Expedition – MENU (Most Entertaining Naval Unit ) Trophy.’ In all, 72 selected cadets of NCC Naval wing are participating in the camp.

title: AAP fields industrialist Rajinder Gupta for Rajya Sabha bypoll from Punjab
content: The bypoll is being held to fill the vacancy created by the resignation of AAP’s Sanjeev Arora, who stepped down from the Upper House following his election to the State Assembly

title: Two brothers died of heart attack
content: Satish Bagannavar (16), who was studying in SSLC, suffered a heart attack at 4 a.m. on Saturday (October 4, 2025); on hearing this, his elder brother Basavaraj Bagannavar (24) collapsed

title: Nine killed, two missing as heavy rain triggers massive landslips in Darjeeling
content: The IMD has issued a red alert for extremely heavy rainfall in sub-Himalayan West Bengal, including Darjeeling and Kalimpong, till October 6

title: Couple held for murder of seven-year-old girl in Yakutpura
content: The motive stemmed from a family dispute; Sami Ali and Yasmeen Begum, the child’s maternal uncle and aunt, had longstanding financial disagreements with the victim’s mother, police said

title: NIA chargesheets four accused in Punjab former Minister’s residence grenade attack case
content: According to the NIA, Kulbeer Singh, an operative of the banned outfit Babbar Khalsa International (BKI), conspired with his associate Manish aka Kaka Rana and formed a gang to target the prominent leaders of Punjab and to create terror among the general public for raising funds for BKI through extortion

title: Madhya Pradesh doctor, who prescribed cough syrup, detained after 11 children die
content: The case has been filed under BNS Sections 105 and 276, and Section 27 of the Drugs and Cosmetics Act

title: Telangana urges managers of waqf institutions to adapt to UMEED portal
content: The apprehension among mutawallis stems from their belief that the TGWB, as the official record-keeper, should already possess documents establishing a property’s nature as waqf

title: In Frames: Draped in tribute
content: In Ahmedabad’s old city, the legend of Saduma lives on as Barot men don saris and perform garba every Navratri Ashtami in a ritual of penance and cultural memory

title: National Green Tribunal flags rising ozone pollution in Indian cities
content: The Central Pollution Control Board said that the Delhi-NCR and Mumbai Metropolitan Region reported higher exceedances of ozone concentration compared with other regions

title: Piyush Goyal calls for greater collaboration between India, Singapore businesses
content: Piyush Goyal also held meeting with Loh Chin Hua, CEO of Keppel, and discussed emerging opportunities in India across various areas, including waste-to-energy, infrastructure, data centres, and digital connectivity.

title: Cooperation of Singapore-based Assamese vital for Zubeen Garg case: Assam CM
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma said the late singer-composer’s well-wishers should exert pressure on the parents to make their wards in the island country come to Assam for questioning

title: Patchwork roads
content: The tragic death of a 20-year-old student after she came under the wheels of a tipper truck while trying to negotiate a pothole in Bengaluru, earlier this week, has raised questions about the quality of roads across the country. In the southern metropolis of Chennai, the state of roads has always been the flashpoint between the residents and the government. R. Aishwaryaa finds that at the core of the issue of poor-quality roads is inadequate coordination between different government departments

title: 57.11 lakh women screened at 25,192 free medical camps in A.P., says Health Minister
content: Apart from blood pressure, diabetes, TB and sickle cell tests, women were screened for cervical, breast and oral cancers, says Satya Kumar

title: T.N. moves Supreme Court against Governor reserving Kalaignar University Bill for Presidential reference
content: The State government has further sought the court to direct the Governor to act under Article 200 (grant of assent) of the Constitution in accordance with the aid and advice of the Council of Ministers.

title: Flood impact: Suicide prevention helplines start buzzing in Marathwada
content: Maharashtra has seen ravaging floods in the last few weeks. Marathwada has been the worst affected region

title: Trinamool highlights NCRB report on low crime rate in Kolkata
content: The BJP leadership in the State, however, disputed the claims of Kolkata being the safest city and claimed that the data provided by the West Bengal government to NCRB is manipulated to present a rosy picture

title: CRS, the premier centre for Russian language and literature in India, turns 60
content: Since 1965, alumni of the Centre of Russian Studies have contributed across the domains of diplomacy, academia, defence, Intelligence, and business, with the institute continuing to be in focus in view of the Ukraine crisis

title: What is Nagaland’s job quota issue? | Explained
content: Why is the government relooking its jobs policy? Why are the tribes in the State divided on the policy?

title: Hope speaks a universal language; fight for dignity, democracy same: Rahul in Colombia
content: Artists who use colour as resistance, and students who dream fearlessly inspire me, Rahul Gandhi said

title: Why is a spectre of empty classrooms looming? | Explained
content: What has the Supreme Court ruled on the Teachers’ Eligibility Test? How many teachers are likely to be affected? Why has Tamil Nadu sought a review? What does Article 21A lay down? What is the situation in other States? Are minority institutions part of the verdict?

title: Controversy over remarks on Balasaheb Thackeray’s death, Shiv Sena UBT to file defamation case
content: Sena UBT leader Anil Parab said that the claims made by Ramdas Kadam were a figment of imagination and were made to divert attention from the issues being faced by Maharashtra

title: Allahabad High Court refuse interim protection to Sambhal’s Rayan Buzurg Mosque from demolition
content: The mosque management, in its plea, had claimed that the notices issued were in ‘gross violation’ of the Supreme Court’s directions issued last year which mandated adherence to due process before demolition of religious structures

title: Supreme Court to hear Wangchuk’s wife’s plea on October 6
content: Dr. Gitanjali J. Angmo has asked the apex court to direct the authorities to produce Wangchuk in court

title: How is India responding to crowding disasters? | Explained
content: Why did things get out of hand at actor Vijay’s political rally in Tamil Nadu? What are the crowd control protocols in place? Are these measures statutory? Where have the most enforceable initiatives emerged? Should responsibility of managing crowds be fixed on organisers?

title: Sir Creek | A marshland of contention
content: The 96-km-long estuary that lies between Kutch and Pakistan’s Sindh is of enormous economic importance, and became a flashpoint following Pakistan’s May 8 strikes against India

title: Paddy coverage in Cauvery delta during current Samba season lower than last year
content: The farmers and officials attribute a number of reasons for this fall, with the main one being the late sowing during the short-term Kuruvai season thanks to the unseasonal spell of rain in February-April this year

title: Sonam Wangchuk | Ladakh’s engineer of change
content: The education reformer, roped in by Ladakh’s civil society groups to represent their causes, has been arrested under the National Security Act

title: Political rallies and tragedy: from the pages of a novella
content: Vazhga Vazhga, authored by Sahitya Akademi award winner Imayam, is about a crowd that gathers at the election rally of a female politician and the chaos that ensues

title: 2026 Assembly election is about protecting rights of Tamils, says Chief Minister M.K. Stalin
content: Stating that his govt., with the people’s support, revived T.N. after 10 years of misrule by the AIADMK, Stalin says only the DMK-led front has the ideological clarity to take on the NDA

title: Technical sanction accorded for Vaduthala-Perandoor bridge
content: Bridge expected to ease city’s growing traffic congestion and provide an easy passage connecting Pachalam and Vaduthala with Perandoor, says Ernakulam MLA; administrative sanction of ₹34.24 crore granted

title: Curve on Chambakkara-Petta stretch turns death trap
content: Two youths lost their lives after their bike rammed a metro pillar near Chambakkara market in the early hours of on Oct. 4, 2025; another accident at the same curve had claimed two lives in January

title: Ernakulam tops in domestic tourist arrivals post-COVID
content: Over 1.19 crore domestic tourists visited the State in the first six months of 2025, marking a 10.50% increase compared to the previous year

title: ₹203 crore for Kempegowda memorials and urban design college: DKS
content: Mr Shivakumar said students graduating from the college will be considered for employment in the Greater Bengaluru Authority(GBA) and municipal bodies.

title: Watch: Kailash Mansarovar Yatra | The Sacred journey resumes
content: Rising high on the Tibetan Plateau, stands Mount Kailash. To millions, it is not just a mountain. It is the axis of the universe, a gateway to the divine

title: UP Man Avenges Father's Murder After 14 Years, Shoots Killer Dead
content: A 45-year-old man was allegedly shot dead by a youth in an apparent act of revenge for his father's murder 14 years ago in Manglora village in Uttar Pradesh, police said on Sunday.

title: 14 Dead In Darjeeling After Heavy Rain Triggers Landslides, Sikkim Cut Off
content: Fourteen people have died in West Bengal's Darjeeling after heavy rain triggered landslides and cut off road connectivity on key routes. Officials have said the calamity has cut off connectivity to the Himalayan state of Sikkim.

title: Madhya Pradesh Doctor Who Prescribed Deadly Cough Syrup To Children Arrested
content: The Madhya Pradesh government also filed a case against Srisan Pharmaceuticals, the company that manufactured the Coldrif syrup.

title: Biren Singh, MLAs Camp In Delhi To Push For Government Revival In Manipur
content: A team of BJP legislators led by former Manipur Chief Minister N Biren Singh is camping in Delhi seeking the formation of a new government in Manipur.

title: Bihar BJP Chief's Burqa Remark, Deputy Chief Minister's Ghoonghat Parallel
content: Bihar BJP chief Dilip Jaiswal's demand for the verification of burqa-clad voters during the upcoming Bihar election has sparked a massive row, with the RJD accusing the BJP of resorting to the politics of "hatred".

title: Trump's Budget "Grim Reaper" Eyeing Big Cuts Amid US Government Shutdown
content: Russell Vought, who heads the Office of Management and Budget, is using the US government shutdown to deliver his brand of shock therapy to American bureaucracy.

title: Indonesia School Collapse Death Count Rises To 37, Search On For 26
content: Part of the multi-storey building on Indonesia's Java island suddenly collapsed on Monday as students gathered for afternoon prayers.

title: US Woman Marries Cop Who Helped Find Her After She Ran Away 12 Years Ago
content: A woman who ran away from home as a frightened 13-year-old has fallen in love with the police officer who once helped search for her.

title: Defiant Netanyahu Vows To Disarm Hamas Amid Talks To Free Gaza Hostages
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday vowed to "disarm" Hamas either the "easy or the hard way" - a day after the Palestinian group accepted parts of Trump's Gaza peace plan.

title: "Planned, Created Incident": BJP On Stampede At Actor Vijay's Rally In Karur
content: 41 people died and at least 60 were injured in the stampede during Vijay's rally on September 27 in Karur.

title: Farmer Wins Rs 50 Lakh On KBC. He Had Been Preparing Since 2018
content: A farmer from Maharashtra who lost his crops to floods has found a new beginning on Amitabh Bachchan's quiz show Kaun Banega Crorepati (KBC).

title: Kolkata Tops 'Safe Cities' List Again. What RG Kar Victim's Parents Said
content: The father of the RG Kar Medical College rape victim has strongly contested the National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) report that labels Kolkata as the safest city in India, calling it a misrepresentation of ground realities.

title: Indian Dental Student, Working Part-Time At US Gas Station, Shot Dead
content: A 27-year-old Indian student has reportedly been shot dead in Dallas, US. Chandrashekar Pole, who was from Hyderabad, was working part-time at a gas station last night when he was killed by an unidentified gunman.

title: After Private Fact-Finding Report On Ladakh, Chief Secretary's Response
content: Ladakh Chief Secretary Pawan Kotwal has held "certain sections" responsible for working to sabotage talks after they realised the dialogue process would be able to meet most of the demands of the people of Ladakh.

title: Manipur BJP MLAs In Delhi To Meet Central Leaders, Seek Government Formation
content: BJP MLAs and leaders from Manipur including former chief minister N Biren Singh will meet the party's central leaders to discuss the formation of a popular government in the state.

title: Drums, Bikes And Conservatism: The Making Of Japan's First Woman PM
content: Sanae Takaichi has been elected as the head of Japan's Liberal Democratic Party (LDP), placing her in line to become the nation's first woman prime minister.

title: 'Move Quickly Or Bets Will Be Off': Trump To Hamas On Gaza Peace Plan
content: US President Donald Trump on Saturday warned Palestinian group Hamas to "move quickly" and agree to a peace deal with Israel or risk further devastation in Gaza.

title: "Ready To Start Dialogue Process, Will Protect Land, Jobs": Top Ladakh Official
content: In its first detailed policy statement following violence in Ladakh, the government today announced a slew of confidence-building measures, including protection of land, jobs, and the demographic character of the Ladakh region.

title: High Drama In Kerala As Man Hacks Father, Holds Police At Bay For Hours
content: A family dispute over land papers spiralled into violence and high drama at Kerala's Thrissur on Saturday, when a man hacked his father with a machete and later threatened suicide by barricading himself inside a house for hours.

title: Former Sarpanch's Son Shot Dead In Punjab's Barnala, Probe Underway: Cops
content: The son of an ex-sarpanch, who was in his 40s, was shot dead by an assailant at a village in Barnala district on Saturday, police said.

title: Govt. will resolve PHC doctors’ issues, says A.P. Health Minister
content: Their demands will be taken to the notice of the Chief Minister and an appropriate decision taken soon, says Satya Kumar Yadav

title: Debris dumped in Cooum due to elevated corridor work raises flooding risk: residents
content: As the width of the river had reduced to around 30 metre at several locations where work by pile operating machines is under way, engineers say the width of the river has to be increased to 70 metre to manage an event of cloudburst this monsoon

title: E-auction of Presidential gifts extended till October 15
content: Over 250 gifts available to art lovers and general public; bids for ₹10,000 specimen bank note given to former President Pranab Mukherjee cross ₹17 lakh

title: Health Ministry initiates risk-based inspection of drug manufacturing firms, following contamination in some cough syrup samples tested in Tamil Nadu
content: This move will help finding out the gaps leading to quality failure of drug samples and suggest process improvement, the Ministry said

title: Supreme Court to hear plea challenging Telangana’s enhancement of OBC quota to 42% in local bodies
content: Petition asking if States can breach 50% quota cap in local bodies; the Telangana State Election Commission has notified the panchayat election process in the State to commence from October 9

title: 30 of 70 detained youth released; Ladakh’s land, jobs and livelihood would remain protected: Chief Secretary
content: Dr. Pawan Kotwal says 40 others would be released upon court orders. Meanwhile, Leh Bar Association member advocate Dorjay Gyaltsan says the magisterial inquiry into the September 24 Leh violence is not going in the right direction and detainees are being harassed.

title: Rajya Sabha Chairman calls for meeting of floor leaders
content: A total of 34 leaders have been invited for the meeting, including Leader of the House and Union Minister J.P. Nadda, Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju, and his two deputies, Arjun Ram Meghwal and L. Murugan

title: Karnataka reconstitutes organ-specific panels under SOTTO for transparent, expert-driven transplants
content: Karnataka’s Health Department has reconstituted organ-specific advisory committees under the State Organ and Tissue Transplant Organisation to bring greater transparency, efficiency, and clinical expertise into the organ allocation and transplantation process

title: Vision group formed for providing facilities at ‘C’ category temples in Karnataka
content: The Hindu Religious Institutions and Charitable Endowments Department has constituted a vision group, consisting of seven members, for making recommendations for undertaking development of infrastructure at 34,165 ‘C’ category historical and ancient temples in the State

title: Jal Shakti Minister refutes allegations of unilateral release of water from Damodar Valley Corporation reservoirs
content: For the past several years, the West Bengal government and the DVC have been at loggerheads over release of water from reservoirs into the lower Damodar basin

title: Inquiry ordered after one-and-a-half-year-old dies at Shishu Gruha in Anantapur
content: The baby, handed over to the Women and Child Welfare department due to the mother’s financial difficulties, dies on Dasara

title: Bareilly authorities demolish ‘illegal’ banquet hall owned by man accused in September 26 violence

title: London court to hear Nirav Modi plea on extradition trial
content: Hearing on November 23 as fugitive diamantaire seeks to reopen extradition trial citing fear of questioning by Indian agencies

title: ED attaches assets worth ₹423 crore of Ozone Urbana Infra Developers
content: The Enforcement Directorate provisionally attaches ₹423.38 crore properties of Ozone Urbana Infra Developers Private Limited for defrauding homebuyers and diverting funds

title: Veteran Rajasthan Congress leader Rameshwar Dudi passes away
content: He had been in a coma for two years following a stroke; Dudi’s body was cremated in the presence of senior Congress leaders, party workers and his supporters

title: PHC doctors continue their strike for fifth day in Andhra Pradesh
content: They are demanding an increase in the in-service quota and payment of allowances for those working in the tribal areas

content: Although the report by Singapore police ruled out any foul play, people in Assam were not convinced.

title: BJP again targets Rahul Gandhi over remarks made in Colombia

title: Top regression candidates for 2025-26: Geekie, Scheifele, more

title: Results and analysis from every fight
content: Alex Pereira  got his revenge against  Magomed Ankalaev , beating Ankalaev by first-round TKO to reclaim the UFC light heavyweight championship in the main event at UFC 320 in Las Vegas on Saturday night. Pereira immediately walked Ankalaev down, backing him up near the fence before dropping Ankalaev with a punch and finishing the fight with ground-and-pound on the mat. With the win, Pereira became the third fighter to win the light heavyweight title multiple times. Ankalaev had previously beat Pereira by unanimous decision at UFC 313 to win the belt earlier this year. In the co-main event,  Merab Dvalishvili  earned his  third UFC men's bantamweight title defense , beating  Cory Sandhagen  by unanimous decision. Dvalishvili dropped the first round to the challenger but found his rhythm in Round 2 and never looked back, scoring 20 takedowns and nearly knocking out Sandhagen en route to the victory. Brett Okamoto, Andreas Hale and Jeff Wagenheim break down all the action at UFC 320.

title: How the Aces defeated the Mercury
content: the no. 2 Las Vegas Aces beat the Phoenix Mercury 89-86 in game 1 of the 2025 WNBA Finals on friday . Dana Evans scored 21 points off the bench, matching the game high of four-time MVP A'ja Wilson and Mercury star Kahleah Copper . jewell Loyd also added 18 points, making them the first pair of teammates with at least 15 points as reserves in a Finals game since 2019 .

title: Don't be surprised if ... Cook leads RBs in season scoring, Daniels is top-five QB
content: field Yates has Deebo Samuel as a top-20 fantasy wide receiver in week 5 against the Chargers . all mentions of fantasy points are for PPR formats, unless otherwise noted . RB James Cook rushed for 16 touchdowns last season, but seven running backs scored more .

title: Women's Bracketology: UConn projects as top overall seed with one month to season
content: a month before the 2025-26 season opens, there's a fresh look at what may look like . if we last forecasted the bracket in April, the UConn Huskies had just been crowned champions . it's the big news as we enter the final months before the season .
